org.chocosolver.samples.statistical.modelfit.linear.normal

Class LinearModelFitNormalCIBatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chocosolver.samples.AbstractProblem
      • org.chocosolver.samples.statistical.modelfit.linear.normal.LinearModelFitNormalCIBatch

  • public class LinearModelFitNormalCIBatch
extends org.chocosolver.samples.AbstractProblem
    This class implements the example described in R. Rossi, O. Agkun, S. Prestwich, A. Tarim, "Declarative Statistics," arxiv:1708.01829, Section 5.1 We consider a set of random variates v_t generated according to v_t = a*t+b+e_t Our aim is to determine nominal coverage probability for linear model parameter confidence intervals represented by the declarative statistics model given a random error e_t (normal)
    Author:
    Roberto Rossi

        Random variate generation
        Parameters:
        rnd - random seed
        slope - linear model slope
        intercept - linear model intercept
        normalMean - random error mean
        normalstd - random error standard deviation
        nbObservations - number of variates
